txt.en: 'It is you and this pitiful host who should flee.'
'Be my fate sealed or not, my arrow shall fly true!'
'The Dark Lord holds no power over me, wraith!'
'Stay back! I will leave you in peace for what you have done!'
'Terms? Have we assembled so great an Alliance that your Master now seeks to surrender?'
'Rest easy, my friend, you are safe from harm in Imladris.'
'And if we should accept? What promise can he give that he shall not again make war against us?'
'The wound has healed, but [placeholder] remains in need of rest, Harthalín.'
'I come here often to reflect on the sacrifices we made in that War....'
'Indeed, Gil-galad and Elendil defeated the Dark Lord, but they did so at the cost of their own lives.'
'The realms of Elves and Men were thus forever changed, and the world passed into the Third Age.'
'Face your doom, Men of the East!'
'Cease this laying of blame and talk of the dishonoured!'
'Indeed, the fates of Númenor and Eregion are tragic, but Sauron's wrath has grown only more terrible since those Dark Years.'
'We have called upon all the armies and peoples we could, but it still may not be enough!'
'King Rioc the oathbreaker and his traitorous kin have fled into the mountains...'
'...and Durin has sent only a few hundred of his folk!'
'The Rider... ran me down... I... cannot...'
'Prince Thranduil lives... but the Rider has him...'
'Hearken to me, Elves and Men! The time for debate is ended!'
'Leave me, friend... he is trapped... in the vale...'
'Sauron sows only division among those who would oppose him - and see now what it has done!'
'Thank you... I can make it as far as the garrison...'
'The Kings of Lórien and the Woodland Realm pressed their forces into certain defeat, and why?'
'The Rider cast us aside as he passed... even the Orcs fled at his approach...'
'They allowed their pride to blind them to the Enemy's treachery!'
'Walk with me, [placeholder].'
'I shall make for the garrison. Thank you for keeping the Orcs from me...'
'If we fall to defeat in this battle, there will never again be a force to oppose him.'
'We held for a time, but the Rider split our ranks and slew all that stood in his path as he rode westward!'
'The Dark Lord gathers strength anew beyond the Black Gate! We must throw down the Morannon!
'Thank you, my friend.'
'We must put an end to his evil before--'
'I... I could not stand against the Orcs after the Rider passed...'
'Hold. Their sentry seems on the edge of sleep....'
'Allow them to ride forth unhindered, but remain on guard. We shall meet them in the field.'
'At last the bearers of the Nine Rings reveal themselves...'
DNT
'They approach.'
DNT
'His strength is returning, but he remains in restless slumber. A few months more, I think....'
'Since chance has woken you today, perhaps he too is healed of the Enemy's wounds.'
DNT
'See if he has woken from his long rest, and then we shall speak more of your journey to the Havens.'
'Go, my friend! I shall ready the Alliance to advance upon the Morannon!'
'High King Gil-galad has summoned us, [placeholder].'
'Let us go!'
'Come on, [placeholder]!'
'Hold fast! You do not fight alone!'
Rescued wounded soldiers from the Orcs west of the forward garrison (1/5)
Rescued wounded soldiers from the Orcs west of the forward garrison (2/5)
Instance: Into Darkness Falls A Star
Rescued wounded soldiers from the Orcs west of the forward garrison (3/5)
Rescued wounded soldiers from the Orcs west of the forward garrison (4/5)
Rescued wounded soldiers from the Orcs west of the forward garrison (5/5)
'Can it be?'
'Lord Elrond, [placeholder] has awoken at last!'
'You will surrender them, and swear oaths to never again come before the gates of Mordor.'
'Rest well, my friend. I shall return in...'
'Prince Amroth... can you tell my companion about the Rider you saw?'
'It can be no other, Hithgol. The Witch-king has taken Thelaron!'
'If the Men of the East hold the hillside, then we must go by secret steps...'
'Thank you, Prince Amroth.'
'For soon, no shelter -- no matter how well-hidden --  shall be free of Sauron's dominion.'
'There is no escape for you...'
'See you now the fate of those who defy my Master?''
'Fool! Wills can be broken, Thranduil of Greenwood, and this blade shall see to that.'
'I do not wish to alarm you, [placeholder], but it is now the three thousand and eighteenth year of the Third Age.'
'What is this?'
'Even if much else has changed, Imladris is as you remember it.'
'The accursed spawn of Ungwetári! You think to threaten me?!'
'You have borne many burdens in your time, my friend, and so I give you leave to depart to the Havens if you wish it.'
'Sauron shall not forgive Her this time!'
'As much as I do not wish to recall him, I can.'
'From what you have told me, he was one of the Nine Gwetherain -- garbed in black and seated atop a great steed.'
'No... it cannot be!'
'There was a sorcery in his gaze, I tell you, for his eyes were as flames in a void!'
'He lifted aloft a great mace, and with a crack of thunder, his Master's statue was toppled.'
'It was then he looked upon me, and what remained beneath his hood sniffed madly at the air.'
'Perhaps he thought me slain, for he then rode on into the hills...'
'High King! Riders approach from beyond the Morannon!'
'I know not if he still lived, but an Elf was slung limply across the Gwatharan's steed.'
'It is a meagre assemblage - only nine in number. Might the Enemy seek to parley at last?'
'Be wary! The Men of the East who slew my father have an encampment in the hills, and it is there he must have gone!'
'They approach!'
'He offers none.'
'You come too late, servant of Gil-galad!'
'Your fear has left you defenceless, and the Elf has been borne away by the winged beasts of my Master!'
'The Rings have drawn them into the realm of the Unseen! So it is true!'
'The Elf-king will never see him again, for he shall suffer evermore in the dungeons of Barad-dûr!
'The shadow-kings, the Gwetherain... they have returned out of the darkness!'
'But you, [placeholder]... you shall be changed, and you will return to Gil-galad as his greatest foe!'
'Such is the will of Sauron!'
'Suffer now, and rise anew into the realm of the Unseen!'
'I am no mere servant! You speak to a King of Men and the Lord of the Nazgûl!'
'Go, [placeholder]! Do not worry for me!'
'[placeholder]... can it be?'
'The stairs up the hill lead to the overlook! You must save Thelaron!'
'Follow me! Lady Harthalín shall want to speak with you!'
'We must move quietly, [placeholder]. It is not far now.'
'Go now! I shall keep them from following!'
'Lady Harthalín! [placeholder] has come from across the battle plain!'
'Speak then, servant of Sauron!'
'There is another here who sustained a terrible wound in the War -- Hithgol is his name.'
'Peace cannot be made with Sauron - such an offer is merely another of his lies!'
'You remember the War as if it were yesterday, do you not?'
'Silence, Elf-wretch! These are His terms!'
'Go now! Flee to your Master and tell him that his doom approaches!'
'You are one of the few that remain in this realm that can recall it as I do, my friend.'
'Nazgûl... do you no longer speak in your own tongue? You are no King -- the Ring you bear has seen to that.'
'And so it has been for many years now...'
'[placeholder], let us speak.'
'Be swift and safe, [placeholder]!'
'I shall make for the garrison... and hope I never see that wraith again...'
A distant horn blows as a scout rushes down from the nearby hillside!
'Swiftly now! This way!'
'Ah, the Elf-king and the accursed Faithful...'
'Sauron is swift to twist the pride and fear of his foes into weapons of his own.'
'My Master has bidden me to deliver His terms.'
'The Men of Númenor that remain in this realm know his treachery all too well.'
'Sauron the Great speaks not of His surrender, but of yours.'
'Even those of us who resisted Sauron's deceit still suffered the loss of our homeland.'
'You would be wise, indeed, to accept His kindness.'
'Only then shall Sauron himself be forced to atone for the evil he has laid upon our peoples!'
'...unless you wish for the rest of your lands to be swept away.'
'Sauron does not wield his servants as ambassadors.'
'These are His terms!'
'Celebrimbor crafted Three Rings in mockery of His design...'
'So be it.'
'Glorfindel and I shall tend the Prince's wounds. Go now, [placeholder]!'
'Sauron the Great has stayed my hand for the moment, but His patience is nearly ended.'
